newsitem.title: CANADA: Southam buys dailies from Thomson.
newsitem.headline: Southam buys dailies from Thomson.

text.p: Southam Inc said on Monday it has purchased seven Ontario newspapers from Thomson Corp for undisclosed terms.
The acquisition includes six dailies for a combined circulation of 100,000, and one weekly newspaper and related publications.

The dailies are: The Chatham Daily News, the Cornwall Standard-Freeholder, the Kirkland Lake Northern Daily News, the Sarnia Observer, The Sudbury Star and the Timmins Daily Press. The weekly is the Elliot Lake Standard.
Southam said the newspapers generate strong operating margins and cash flows.
"This acquisition strengthens our presence in Ontario and fits well with Southam's strategic focus on newspaper publishing," Southam President Don Babick said in a statement.
